MODï¼šShadersMOD2.4.0

1.7.5çš„å…‰å½±å®‰è£…æ•™ç¨‹ï¼ˆè‹±æ–‡ï¼‰ï¼š

Shaders Mod v2.4.0 alpha for Minecraft 1.7.5 !
For advanced user/tester only.

Info
This does not require Forge or FML.
It is a little more difficult to install this than previous version.
You will have to do some copy-paste and text file editing.
I will make an installer later. That will take more time.

Download
ShadersModCore-2.4.0mc1.7.5.jar link1

Required Libraries
asm-all-4.1.jar
Â Â If you have already installed and run forge, you should already have this file.
Â Â If you don't have it already, you can get it from this link to download a zip file.Â Â Extract asm-all-4.1.jar from the zip.

Installation
- Run Minecraft 1.7.5 at least once.Â Â Close Minecraft and Launcher.
- Copy ShadersModCore-2.4.0mc1.7.5.jar to the following path and filename.
Â Â %APPDATA%\.minecraft\libraries\shadersmodcore\ShadersModCore\2.4.0mc1.7.5\ShadersModCore-2.4.0mc1.7.5.jar
- Make sure you also have required libraries
Â Â %APPDATA%\.minecraft\libraries\org\ow2\asm\asm-all\4.1\asm-all-4.1.jar
- Make a copy of folder
Â Â %APPDATA%\.minecraft\versions\1.7.5
- Rename the copied folder to
Â Â %APPDATA%\.minecraft\versions\1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0
- Open folder 1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0
- Rename 1.7.5.jarÂ Â to 1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0.jar (same name as folder)
- Rename 1.7.5.json to 1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0.json (same name as folder)
- Open the json file with Notepad++ (or other text editor program)
- Edit value of id. (equals to folder name)

Quote
Â Â "id": "1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0",
- Edit value of minecraftArguments. Make sure there is a space in front ofÂ Â --tweakClass.

Quote
Â Â "minecraftArguments": "--username ${auth_player_name} --version ${version_name} --gameDir ${game_directory} --assetsDir ${assets_root} --assetIndex ${assets_index_name} --uuid ${auth_uuid} --accessToken ${auth_access_token} --userProperties ${user_properties} --userType ${user_type} --tweakClass shadersmodcore.loading.SMCTweaker",
- Add libraries.

Quote
Â Â "libraries": [
Â  Â  {
Â  Â Â  Â "name": "shadersmodcore:ShadersModCore:2.4.0mc1.7.5"
Â  Â  },
Â  Â  {
Â  Â Â  Â "name": "net.minecraft:launchwrapper:1.9"
Â  Â  },
Â  Â  {
Â  Â Â  Â "name": "org.ow2.asm:asm-all:4.1"
Â  Â  },
Â  Â  {
Â  Â Â  Â "name": "java3d:vecmath:1.3.1"
Â  Â  },
- Edit value of mainClass.

Quote
Â Â "mainClass": "net.minecraft.launchwrapper.Launch",
- Save 1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0.json
- Reopen Minecraft Launcher
- Create a new profile, edit profile, select version 1.7.5-ShadersMod2.4.0. Save.
- Select the profile and click Play.
- Test.

EDIT:
1. ShadersModCore-2.4.0mc1.7.5.jar is updated once in 03/03/2014 to fix block ID bug (which result in no waving of everything). If you downloaded it before the update, you may redownload it.
2. If you have installed Forge or FML for Minecraft 1.7.2, you should already have asm-all-4.1 and launchwrapper-1.9 in libraries folder.
If don't installed Forge or FML, you have to download asm-all-4.1 and add it to libraries.
You don't have to manually download launchwrapper-1.9. Minecraft Launcher can download it automatically.
3. Add link for download asm-all-1.4. Edit instruction.
